oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Original wills, Armstrong, Robert, 1858 July 04
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pertains to a nuncupative will (verbal) of Robert Armstrong, dated July 4th, 1858. Stating his desires to “settle up all his indebtedness; and remit two hundred dollars of the balance or surplus to his brother in or near Pittsburg, the remainder to be sent to his mother in Glasgow, Scotland.” The verso cites “recorded in Book No. 15, Pages 57 & 58. Forms part of Record Group 16, Original Wills, 1780-1925.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wills--Tennessee--Davidson County
